thread.title: Conor McGregor lashes out at fan's phone as UFC champion drives supercar around Dublin
thread.title_full: Conor McGregor lashes out at fan's phone as UFC champion drives supercar around Dublin

author: mirror
title: Conor McGregor lashes out at fan's phone as UFC champion drives supercar around Dublin
text:
Sport Conor McGregor lashes out at fan's phone as UFC champion drives supercar around Dublin The Notorious was clearly not in the mood to be filmed as a supporter got to meet his hero on the streets of the Irish capital Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Conor McGregor lashes out at Dublin lad's phone Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Conor McGregor has been filmed taking a swipe at a fan's phone after being spotted out in public. 
McGregor has been spotted in Dublin numerous times in recent weeks as he enjoys time off from UFC action ahead of the birth of his first child with girlfriend Dee Devlin. 
But the Crumlin man clearly didn't appreciate being approached by a young Dublin lad with a camera phone while he was sitting in one of his luxury sports cars, report Dublin Live. 
The UFC superstar appears to ignore the young lad filming him before angrily taking a swipe at the phone and raising his window. McGregor was not happy with being filmed He launched his hand at the fan's phone But the fan appeared to take it in good spirit 
The clip was uploaded to Snapchat and captioned "just met Conor McGregor and he went for me." 
McGregor is currently enjoying a break from the Octagon, but has been strongly linked with a sensational switch to boxing to take on retired former pound-for-pound king Floyd Mayweather Jnr. MCGregor is enjoying time away from the Octagon (Photo: Zuffa LLC) He has not competed since he become a two-weight UFC champion (Photo: Brandon Magnus/Zuffa LLC/Getty) 
Conor McGregor has taken MMA to the masses but can take it higher still 
UFC chief Dana White made a public offer to Mayweather earlier this month to fight the Irishman for $25million. 
The American flatly rejected that fee but is understood to have a deep interest in what would potentially be a box-office breaking bout. Like us on Facebook
